metadata.title: CVE-2019-2911 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server product of Oracle MySQL (component:Information Schema). Supported versions that are affected are 5.6.45 andprior, 5.7.27 and prior and 8.0.17 and prior. Easily exploitablevulnerability allows high privileged attacker with network access viamultiple protocols to compromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks of thisvulnerability can result in unauthorized read access to a subset of MySQLServer accessible data. CVSS 3.0 Base Score 2.7 (Confidentiality impacts).CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:H/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:N/A:N).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-2911` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient21 - 8.0.18-0ubuntu3
mysql-client - 8.0.18-0ubuntu3
mysql-client-8.0 - 8.0.18-0ubuntu3
mysql-client-core-8.0 - 8.0.18-0ubuntu3
mysql-router - 8.0.18-0ubuntu3
mysql-server - 8.0.18-0ubuntu3
mysql-server-8.0 - 8.0.18-0ubuntu3
mysql-server-core-8.0 - 8.0.18-0ubuntu3
mysql-source-8.0 - 8.0.18-0ubuntu3
mysql-testsuite - 8.0.18-0ubuntu3
mysql-testsuite-8.0 - 8.0.18-0ubuntu3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mysql-8.0 package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.0.18-0ubuntu3').
